If you are presented with an offer, we will review the base salary, benefits, number of options, notional option value and strike price. We would like to know if you accept our offer within 7 days.

Please keep in mind that the equity portion of your offer is not included in these numbers and represents a significant part of your total compensation.

IC I: $110,000-$180,000

IC II: $160,000-$230,000

IC III: $180,000-$300,000

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role & Responsibilities

As a Data Analyst working for Dassault Systèmes, you will utilize your curiosity, analytical savvy and technical expertise to support the North American Business Development Organization. As you grow into your role, you will help design and implement new tools to enhance the data collection and data analysis for the Organization.


Collecting, processing and analyzing large datasets to support business decisions
Developing and maintaining reports, dashboards, and visualizations to provide insights to stakeholders
Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in data driving continuous improvement
Working closely with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and deliver actionable insights
Ensuring data integrity and accuracy through regular validations and audits


Qualifications:


Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Business, Engineering or like discipline
3+ years of experience
Very strong proficiency in Excel
Exposure to tools like NIM, KNIME and data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI
Well-developed analytical and problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal


Compensation for this role will be commensurate with experience. The total expected compensation range will be between $80,000 - $140,000, representing the base salary (or annualized salary based on estimated hourly compensation) and target bonus.

Diversity statement

As a game-changer in sustainable technology and innovation, Dassault Systèmes is striving to build more inclusive and diverse teams across the globe. We believe that our people are our number one asset and we want all employees to feel empowered to bring their whole selves to work every day. It is our goal that our people feel a sense of pride and a passion for belonging. As a company leading change, it’s our responsibility to foster opportunities for all people to participate in a harmonized Workforce of the Future.

Compensation & Benefits

Dassault Systèmes offers an excellent salary with potential for bonus, commensurate with experience. Benefits include a choice of plans providing comprehensive coverage for medical, dental, vision care for employee & dependents as well as employee life, short & long term disability, tuition reimbursement, immediate 401K enrollment, 401K match (50 cents on the dollar, up to the first 8% of your eligible compensation that you contribute based on match eligibility criteria), flexible time off policy, and 10 paid holidays.

Equal opportunity

In order to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all individuals, employment decisions at 3DS are based on merit, qualifications and abilities. 3DS is committed to a policy of non-discrimination and equal opportunity for all employees and qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth or medical or common conditions related to pregnancy or childbirth), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, familial status, national origin, ancestry, age (40 and above), disability, veteran status, military service, application for military service, genetic information, receipt of free medical care, or any other characteristic protected under applicable law. 3DS will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with known disabilities, in accordance with applicable law.

Title: Data Analyst - LCM
Description:
¡Oye, es hora de que te unas a nosotros para mostrarle al mundo que somos la empresa que está cambiando paradigmas, donde revolucionamos las horas, los minutos y los segundos!

¿Quieres saber por qué Rappi?

⭐️ VEMOS OPORTUNIDADES donde otros ven problemas;

⭐️ VEMOS CERCANIA donde otros ven distancia;

⭐️ VEMOS ADRENALINA donde otros ven presión.

Únete a un equipo donde todos somos capaces de TODO, donde todos tenemos las mismas oportunidades, sin importar género, raza, orientación sexual, religión, nacionalidad, edad, discapacidad, formación o experiencia.

¿Te ha gustado lo que has leído hasta ahora? Descubre cómo entregarás magia junto con nosotros a través de tu misión Rappi 🧡

Revisa Cómo Impactarás Nuestro Ecosistema

Serás un colaborador con competencia en programación estadística, utilizando R o Python. Desempeñarás un papel importante en la realización de experimentos y análisis que influirán en nuestra comprensión y en las estrategias empresariales. Se requiere un conocimiento sólido en metodologías estadísticas avanzadas y habilidad para la resolución de problemas basada en el análisis de datos.

Responsabilidades

Como parte de Rappi, serás responsable de:


Diseñar e implementar experimentos controlados, utilizando metodologías como el Efecto Promedio del Tratamiento (ATE), Tratamiento en los Tratados (ToT), Variables Instrumentales/Efecto Promedio del Tratamiento Local (IV/LATE), y Diferencia en Diferencias (DiD).
Emplear R o Python para un análisis detallado y preciso de datos experimentales, incluyendo la aplicación de modelos de regresión logística, emparejamiento en observables y árboles causales.
Trabajar colaborativamente con analistas senior para interpretar datos, desarrollar nuevos modelos y derivar percepciones accionables.
Abrazar una cultura de aprendizaje y desarrollo para mejorar habilidades en diseño experimental y análisis estadístico.
Contribuir con ideas y enfoques innovadores para abordar desafíos experimentales y mejorar metodologías. Comunicar claramente hallazgos y percepciones impulsadas por datos a miembros del equipo y stakeholders.


Bien y ahora, ¿Cuáles son los requisitos para que yo sea parte de este universo de neón?

Requisitos


Competencia intermedia en R o Python, específicamente para análisis estadístico.
Conocimiento de modelos y métodos estadísticos, incluyendo Efecto Promedio del Tratamiento (ATE), Tratamiento en los Tratados (ToT), Variables Instrumentales/Efecto Promedio del Tratamiento Local (IV/LATE), Diferencia en Diferencias (DiD), y modelos de regresión logística.
Fuertes habilidades analíticas y de resolución de problemas con enfoque en precisión y detalle.
Una actitud proactiva de aprendizaje y la capacidad de aplicar efectivamente nuevos métodos estadísticos.
Buenas habilidades de comunicación para presentar datos complejos de manera comprensible.
Habilidades de trabajo en equipo y un enfoque colaborativo en la resolución de problemas.
Un enfoque orientado al crecimiento, abierto a la retroalimentación y dedicado a la mejora continua.


Tipo Empleador

Regular

Empleador

Tarjetas del Futuro

Para más información consulta nuestra pagina web https://about.rappi.com/es y revisa nuestras reseñas en Glassdoor https://acortar.link/Eqm07Q

¡Te esperamos con mucha ansiedad y brillo en los ojos para entregar magia juntos! #Rappi 🧡

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
GA Telesis is the leading provider of integrated services in the commercial aviation industry. Through the GA Telesis Ecosystem™, the Company is distinctly positioned, across six continents, to leverage its resources to create innovative solutions for its customers. Consisting of global operations encompassing Component Solutions, Leasing/Financing, Logistics Solutions, and MRO Services business units for landing gear, component/composite, and turbine engine repair, as well as digital solutions, the GA Telesis Ecosystem™ provides an unparalleled resource to airlines. The Company’s core business is its mission to ensure “Customer Success,” built from a reputation for unsurpassed excellence and integrity.

Job Description: We are currently seeking a dedicated, analytical and detail-oriented Data Analyst. In this role, you will be responsible for turning data into information, information into insight, and insight into business decisions. You will play a crucial part in analyzing market trends, pricing strategies, and inventory management to support our business goals and customer needs.

Key Responsibilities


Analyze and interpret data related to the aviation used serviceable market, focusing on parts pricing, availability, and demand trends.
Assist in the development and maintenance of databases and data systems specific to the aviation industry.
Conduct market research and analysis to support strategic decisions regarding inventory management and procurement.
Collaborate with the sales and procurement teams to understand customer needs and market dynamics.
Generate regular reports on market trends, sales performance, and inventory status using statistical techniques and data visualization tools.
Support the management team in making data-driven decisions by providing actionable insights and recommendations.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity in all analytics and reporting activities.
Stay updated with industry trends, regulatory changes, and technological advancements in the aviation used serviceable market.
Assist in the development of predictive models and algorithms to forecast market behaviors and inventory needs.


Requirements:


Master’s Degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or a Quantitative Discipline.
Minimum of 2 to 3 years of experience in a data analyst role, preferably in the aviation industry or related field.
Proficiency in data analysis tools, software and methods (e.g., ETL, Excel, SQL, Python, R).
Familiarity with libraries/frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn, or spark
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Assist in the development of predictive models and algorithms to forecast market behaviors and inventory needs.
Ability to translate complex data into clear and actionable insights.
Experience working with cloud platforms (i.e. AWS, etc.)
Strong communication and presentation skills, capable of conveying findings clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Organized, detail-oriented, and capable of managing multiple projects simultaneously.
Must be a team player with a collaborative approach but also able to work independently.
Stay-up to date with the latest developments in data science, machine learning, and related fields, and evaluate emerging technologies for potential adoption.


Benefits:


Competitive salary commensurate with experience.
Health, dental, and vision insurance.
Retirement plan options.
Opportunities for career advancement in a growing company.
Professional development and training opportunities.
Show more

Benefits:

  • Retirement plan options.
  • Opportunities for career advancement in a growing company.
  • Professional development and training opportunities.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Safeway Tax is a leading force in the Tax Relief industry, dedicated to helping our clients navigate their financial challenges with expertise and compassion. As one of the fastest-growing companies in our sector, we are on a mission to provide tax debt solutions that offer our clients a fresh start. Our team is expanding, and we are committed to fostering a culture that values innovation, integrity, and collaboration. We are seeking a dedicated and detail-oriented Business Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for interpreting data, analyzing results, and providing insights to support informed decision-making within the organization.




Key Responsibilities:

Collecting and interpreting data from various sources
Analyzing complex data sets to extract meaningful patterns and trends
Developing and implementing data analytics strategies to optimize operational efficiency
Creating visualizations and reports to communicate findings effectively
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and provide analytical support
Identifying opportunities for data-driven improvements and proposing actionable recommendations
Maintaining data integrity and security




Qualifications:

Proven experience in data analysis and data mining techniques
Proficiency in statistical software and database querying languages (SQL, Python)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent communication and presentation abilities
Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment




Benefits:

Competitive salary
Comprehensive healthcare and wellness benefits
Opportunities for professional growth and development
Dynamic and inclusive work environment
Flexible work arrangements
Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance after 90 days
Paid Time Off for vacation and sick leave
Access to an on-site gym
Catered meals every Friday




Application Process:

If you are passionate about leveraging data to drive strategic decision-making and possess the required skills and qualifications, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity.




Note: At Safeway Tax, we believe that diversity and inclusion are essential to our success. We strive to attract, nurture, and retain talented individuals from diverse backgrounds. The above job description outlines the general nature and level of work to be performed and is not exhaustive. Additional responsibilities may be assigned as needed.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
MDM Analyst -HealthCare




The Senior Analyst, MDM will be a key member of the MDM team and will work to develop and maintain the match strategies using data from various data sources including but not limited to our Credentialing and Human Resource systems.




Principal Duties and Responsibilities:




Standard onboarding activities associated with IS&T and Performance Analytics team, navigating/obtaining access to required applications and tools.
Completion of MDM Training modules for Profisee MDM Tools
Formal review of Business Requirements, Operations Guides, Reference Tables, and program artifacts located on Teams/SharePoint Sites
Review of Outgoing Data Model containing views offered to MDM Consumers and associated data dictionaries to familiarize self with the current state of the MDM Program.
Use of Teams Foundation Server (TFS) for the management of development sprint work, ability to draft tasks for upcoming work
Support Master Data Work queues and ticketing to Business Data Stewards:
Daily review of Provider Records Match Queues to validate proposed/excluded records
Provide support to business/technical team members as an experienced consultant in the payor enrollment and medical staff credentialing data management space




Additionally, the role will also require support in the development of basic business requirements. This includes the following tasks.




Identify tables and fields within systems.
Speak to the business source owners in their industry-accepted terms and conditions.
Develop data definitions.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

Contract to Hire

On-site (Seattle, Washington OR Phoenix, AZ)




Our client's Supply Chain team is seeking an experienced candidate to identify, create, develop and integrate innovative solutions and programs that lead to improvements in our warehousing and distribution network. This position will lead the development and execution of new logistics initiatives designed to improve overall efficiency and meet the ever-growing demand for storage of bulk inventory in our strategically located distribution centers. The successful candidate will have strong data mining and modeling skills and is comfortable facilitating ideas and working from concept through to execution.




Key Job Responsibilities :

• Retrieving and analyzing data using Excel, SQL, Access and other data management systems

• Designing and implementing reporting solutions to enable stakeholders to manage the business and make effective decisions

• Manage complex calendars and scheduling with diplomacy and discretion, manage domestic travel, expense report coordination and submission, and organize, execute, and assist with team activities

• Drive small to medium operational enhancement projects

• Excellent problem-solving, task prioritization, follow-up, and customer service skills




**This role may be required to work nights, weekends, and holidays**

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst to join our team and play a key role in transforming data into actionable insights using Power BI and SQL. While experience in business analysis is a plus, this role focuses more on the technical aspects of data manipulation and visualization.




Responsibilities:

Create data visualizations using Power BI.
Write and execute SQL queries to extract data from relational databases.
Develop and maintain stored procedures to automate data retrieval tasks.
Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to SQL databases.
Leverage your expertise in Excel lookup functions for data management, analysis, and validation.
Collaborate with the team to understand existing systems and data pipelines.
Adapt and learn new technologies as needed.




Qualifications:

Proven experience writing and executing SQL queries.
Proficiency in Excel with a strong understanding of lookup functions (VLOOKUP, INDEX MATCH etc.).
Familiarity with Power BI is a plus.
Experience with Google Looker (a plus).
Experience with NetSuite (a plus).




Nice to Haves:

Understanding of Azure Data Factory (ADF).
Ability to stay up-to-date on emerging data analysis trends and technologies.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
PURPOSE:

The programmer analyst positions primary responsibilities will focus on process improvement, query, and report development along with support duties of multiple IT functions. In addition to supporting a variety of process improvement activities, the Analyst will also support change management efforts to ensure solution implementation and achievement of projected business results. Key support elements of the position will focus on our loan originations system, servicing system, PowerBI reporting platform and corporate data warehouse. The role will report to the Director of IT and will be a key contributor primarily supporting the reporting and analytics group.




We are looking for a candidate that can provide relevant insights to leadership by identifying opportunities & challenges, leveraging information related to all facets of the business process. The ideal candidate will have a problem-solving mindset ready to tackle day-to-day issues across multiple support functions including reporting, query, and data quality resolution. change management efforts to ensure solution implementation and achievement of projected business results.




The role bridges the gap between IT and the Business groups, a unique opportunity to use both technical and analytical skills to improve upon current systems with underlying knowledge of the finance business.




POSITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES:

•Reviews and identifies opportunities for query and report optimization.

•Develops the business case for change and looks for improvement through automation.

•Report development within our reporting platform.

•Drive changes that will impact multiple functional or business areas.

•Transform strategies into tactical plans to address issues/risks.

•Setting metrics and goals to ensure sustainment of tactics.

•Responsible for technical support of non-complex systems and procedures in a business unit.

•Manage the ticket system for support on the company data warehouse.

•Diagnoses and resolves user problems.

•Creates, develops, and manages procedural documentation.

•Develop and execute test plans.




QUALIFICATIONS:

•Bachelor’s degree with an emphasis in Computer Science/Information systems or 5 years equivalent relevant work experience.

•On-hands experience with PowerBI dataset management and report development.

•Previous banking or financing experience.

•Experience with SQL, Python, VBA, C#, or other scripting language.

•Strong problem-solving and partnership skills.

•Strong experience in research, problem determination, and issue resolution.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
ABOUT CORDIAL

We founded Cordial in 2014 on the belief that there should be more humanity and empathy in marketing—both in how brands communicate with their customers and in how technology companies work with brands. We built our company and platform purposefully, driven by a desire to inspire more thoughtful communication and to create experiences that feel more personal and human—for consumers, for the people at the companies we work with, and for Cordial employees. Today, brands like PacSun, Revolve, Abercrombie & Fitch, Realtor.com, L.L. Bean and Forbes rely on Cordial to drive revenue growth by sending a better message.

We chose the name Cordial to symbolize how we empower our clients to communicate with their customers, as well as how we do business: with transparency, collaboration, and trust. We're building a passionate team of individuals willing to learn, grow, and be thoughtfully challenged on a daily basis to continuously improve our product, company, and culture every single day.

OUR VALUES


Communicate better than the rest
Tenacious about the client and the problems we solve for them
We're owners and we act like it
Be Cordial


POSITION SUMMARY

We're looking for an experienced, self-driven data enthusiast to shape marketing stories, future strategies and client success. This role demands an analyst with a knack for dissecting large datasets to extract clear, actionable insights. You'll be pivotal in compiling and analyzing client datasets and crafting workbooks to drive optimizations across email, SMS, and in-app push campaigns. Additionally, you'll work to establish and update performance benchmarks and deliver ad hoc reporting based on business needs. The ideal candidate is able to push beyond descriptive analytics into Diagnostic, Predictive and Prescriptive Analytics with ease.

YOU WILL


Analyze historic marketing data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive strategic decision-making.
Develop and maintain complex Excel and Google Sheets workbooks to track and report on key marketing KPIs, including open rates, click-through rates, unsubscribe rates and revenue trends.
Investigate and pinpoint the root causes of data anomalies and trends.
Prepare and deliver presentations to communicate insights, recommendations, and performance metrics to internal leaders as well as clients and other internal stakeholders.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including marketing, product, and engineering, to develop data-driven analysis and recommendations.
Innovate with our Product and Engineering teams to unlock new manners of getting to the right answer while saving time.


ABOUT YOU


Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Marketing)
3+ years of experience in data analysis, preferably in a marketing or digital marketing environment
Familiarity with marketing automation or Email Service Provider platforms
Proficiency in Excel, Google Sheets, Google Analytics, and Tableau
Strong understanding of core marketing analytics KPIs, such as open rates, click-through rates, and unsubscribe rates
Familiarity with statistical experimentation and A/B testing principles
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex information in a clear and concise manner
Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities effectively


COMPENSATION & BENEFITS

$85,000.00 - $115,000.00 annually. The compensation range may be adjusted based on experience and location. In combination with base salary, Cordial's compensation package includes equity and bonus, a robust benefit plan (medical/dental/vision/life), 401k match, flexible time off. Additionally, we offer perks such as monthly wellness and cell phone stipends, childcare and continued education yearly reimbursements. We pride ourselves in maintaining a healthy work/life balance, a strong dedication to DE&I efforts, and an overall respectful and open culture!

Please note: In the current environment, Cordial employees are working completely remote and our recruitment process will entail both phone and video Zoom interviews. And if hired, your onboarding will be done remotely. Stay safe!

Cordial is proud to be an equal opportunity employer that celebrates diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive workplace with equal opportunity for all applicants. Our goal is to recruit the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool regardless of race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability status, sex (including pregnancy), age, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Cordial is committed to working with and providing access and reasonable accommodation to applicants with mental and/or physical disabilities. If you require an accommodation, please reach out to your recruiter once you've begun the interview process. All requests for accommodations are treated discreetly and confidentially, as practical and permitted by law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Data Analyst to join our team. The Data Analyst will be responsible for interpreting data, analyzing results using statistical techniques, and providing ongoing reports to support business decision-making. This role requires proficiency in data manipulation, visualization, and the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.

Roles And Responsibilities


Data Collection and Cleaning:
Collect, preprocess, and clean data from various sources to ensure accuracy and completeness.
Identify and address data quality issues and inconsistencies.
Data Analysis and Interpretation:
Perform exploratory data analysis to discover trends, patterns, and correlations in datasets.
Apply statistical methods and quantitative techniques to analyze data and generate insights.
Data Visualization and Reporting:
Create informative and visually appealing dashboards, reports, and presentations to communicate findings.
Present data and analysis results in a clear and concise manner to stakeholders.
Business Insights and Recommendations:
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and provide data-driven insights.
Translate complex data analysis into actionable recommendations to support strategic decisions.
Performance Monitoring and Forecasting:
Develop and maintain KPIs and metrics to monitor business performance.
Build predictive models and forecasting tools to support planning and decision-making.
Database Management and Querying:
Manage and query databases using SQL and other data manipulation languages.
Optimize data queries and processes to improve efficiency and performance.
Continuous Improvement:
Stay updated with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and visualization.
Propose and implement process improvements and automation initiatives.
Collaboration and Teamwork:
Work closely with cross-functional teams, including IT, marketing, and operations, to support data-related projects and initiatives.
Participate in team meetings, brainstorming sessions, and knowledge sharing activities.

Skills And Qualifications


Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or related field; Master's degree preferred.
X+ years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role, with a strong understanding of data analysis techniques and methodologies.
Proficiency in data manipulation and analysis using tools such as Excel, Python, R, or SQL.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) to create interactive dashboards and reports.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret complex data sets and derive meaningful insights.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts and analysis results to non-technical stakeholders.
Detail-oriented with a commitment to accuracy and quality in data analysis and reporting.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment, with a focus on delivering actionable insights.


Compensation


The salary for this position is competitive and commensurate with experience.
Benefits package includes health insurance, retirement plan options, paid time off, and professional development opportunities.


Application Process

Please submit your resume and cover letter detailing your qualifications and interest in this position. We will contact selected candidates for further interviews.

This job description is crafted to attract qualified candidates for a Data Analyst position by outlining specific responsibilities, required skills, and offering details about compensation and benefits. Adjustments can be made based on the company's industry, size, and specific data analysis needs, such as specialization in particular domains (e.g., healthcare analytics, financial data analysis).

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who you are:


5 years of experience with SQL Server
Experience with Python
Jira or project management tools
Data documentation/ data governance experience
Experience with Databricks is ideal



What You'll Do:


Our client is currently re-vamping their entire data environment including SQL Server and eventually implementing Databricks
This candidate will spend a good amount of time with customers, gathering requirements and turning them into technical project requirements
Discovery with clients, data wrangling, importing data, and documentation within their system



If you are interested, please email your resume to Ryarbrough@provenrecruiting.com

Title: Data Analyst, Data Privacy
Description:
Req120146

Position Purpose

The Data Analyst will participate in a variety of projects related to the governance and management of privacy request data. The analyst will execute medium/multi-dimensional projects, providing insights specific to Privacy and Enterprise Preference Center (EPC) data. They may lead smaller customer data related projects and will accumulate knowledge to become a subject matter expert in Privacy and EPC data. They will be expected to participate in process development, project management, data analysis, and status reporting and may lead these areas for a small project. The Analyst will have a hands-on understanding of the data necessary to drive processes, including analysis using data querying in support of project completion.

Key Responsibilities


50% Participating in the upkeep of an inventory of customer data across the organization, including the approval of any new data creation or sharing based on standards created by our Privacy practice
20% Partnering with the Security as a data owner to grant access to customer data across the organization based on the rules defined by the Privacy team related to data access
20% Conducting data analysis to develop a perspective on data quality issues and helping to resolve certain data quality issues across all customer data repositories
10% Participating in the building and distribution of customer scorecards and data quality dashboards


Direct Manager/Direct Reports


This position reports to the Sr Manager Customer Data Governance.
This position has 0 direct reports.


Travel Requirements


Typically requires overnight travel less than 10% of the time.


Physical Requirements


Most of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position and there is frequent opportunity to move about. On rare occasions there may be a need to move or lift light articles.


Working Conditions


Located in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable.


Minimum Qualifications


Must be eighteen years of age or older.
Must be legally permitted to work in the United States.


Preferred Qualifications


Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite
Demonstrated ability to collaborate and work effectively with cross-functional teams
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Demonstrated experience managing Tableau dashboards.
SQL skills and some experience querying data is preferred Some experience creating process flows is preferred


Minimum Education


The knowledge, skills and abilities typically acquired through the completion of a bachelor's degree program or equivalent degree in a field of study related to the job.


Preferred Education


No additional education


Minimum Years Of Work Experience


1


Preferred Years Of Work Experience


No additional years of experience


Minimum Leadership Experience


None


Preferred Leadership Experience


None


Certifications


None


Competencies


Action Oriented - Taking on new opportunities and tough challenges with a sense of urgency, high energy, and enthusiasm
Collaborates - Building partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives
Communicates Effectively - Developing and delivering multi-mode communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences
Customer Focus - Building strong customer relationships and delivering customer-centric solutions
Show more

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
¡Seguimos creciendo y estamos en búsqueda de apasionados/as del mundo tecnológico!

Nos alejamos del concepto de consultoría tradicional ¿sabes por qué?:

Contratamos para nosotros. Somos fieles a nuestra cultura y queremos compartir contigo nuestra filosofía de trabajo cooperativo, en equipo y de formación continua. Siempre podemos aprender más. Confiamos en la gente y que es posible trabajar bajo pasión, y que sientas en nuestro apoyo tanto en lo profesional como en lo personal. En nuestra cultura nadie es un número, somos un equipo con un estilo de organización transversal, y así queremos que siga.

Ningún mar en calma hizo experto a un marinero. ¿Somos exigentes? Sí, porque nuestros retos los son, pero te desarrollarás entre cracks, en entornos innovadores y con las últimas tendencias tecnológicas. Además, priorizamos el talento y en esta familia nos preocupamos por gente buena que, también, sea buena gente.




Si te apasiona el trabajo en equipo, te encanta aprender cosas nuevas y te interesa la innovación, ¡Nos encantaría conocerte!




Data Analyst




Responsable de la investigación y correcta documentación de las necesidades de datos que tenga el negocio, asi como de traducir los requerimientos de datos/información en solicitudes claras y entendibles para las áreas de Dominios de Datos, Tecnología y Producto para que puedan ser priorizados y atendidos.




Realizar Data Assessment con áreas de Negocio para la conformación de dominios de datos: o Entrevistar al negocio, analizar del flujo de trabajo, estructura y procesos, en sesiones de observación o Matriz de Assessment/Matriz de Trazabilidad de datos o Interpretación y entrega de resultados.
Construcción de consultas base (SQL, insumos) para su implementación por parte de los equipos de desarrollo.
Asegurar que las soluciones de TI reflejen la efectividad necesaria para alcanzar los objetivos comerciales (validación y oportunidades de optimización).
Crear requisitos y documentos de flujo de trabajo claros y concisos.
Incrementar la adopción del negocio de las soluciones de datos a través de la consistencia de datos.
Validar la información mediante pruebas.
Evaluación de calidad de datos.
Diseño de modelos de datos (lógicos, BI).

Skills:

• Comunicación efectiva con directivos y equipos técnicos, de desarrollo.

• Capacidad analítica financiera (prioritario)

• Ingles intermedio/ avanzado (indispensable).

• Conocimientos sólidos en estadística y probabilidad

• Pensamiento estructurado

• Liderazgo

• Autogestión

• Análisis de ETL y flujos de datos




Experiencia:

• Indicadores financieros de Negocios retail

• Análisis de negocios centrado en el dominio de datos y sistemas de inteligencia empresarial (>3 años)

• Entrevistas con usuarios comerciales, recopilación de informes y requisitos de KPI (>3 años)

• Análisis de datos, unión de diferentes fuentes con SQL (nivel avanzado)

• Documentación de requisitos y flujos de trabajo

• Diagramado de soluciones de datos (alto nivel)

• Traducción de requisitos para Ingeniería y Arquitectura de datos, y soluciones BI

• Crear, analizar y entregar métricas clave utilizando paneles, informes y presentaciones (pptx, Google Slides, BI dashboards)

• Construir modelos analíticos avanzados (indispensable)

• Habilidades sólidas de programación (deseable)

• Experiencia con metodologías Agile (SCRUM, Kanban)

• Office Suite (avanzado)

• SQL (avanzado)

• Python (deseable)

• Tableau/Looker/Power BI (intermedio)

• Data Mining (deseable)

• Big Data Best Practices (consulta)

• Marco de trabajo Ágiles

• Big Query (consulta)

• Power BI (deseable)

• Lucidchart/Visio

• Erwin Data Modeler (deseable)




Perfil ideal de un/una bluetaber…

-Apasionado de la tecnología. Completamente al día de las últimas tendencias de la industria.

-Habituado a trabajar por objetivos. Acostumbrado a trabajar bajo presión en entornos altamente exigentes.

-Buen comunicador, sabrá transmitir ilusión al entorno de trabajo.

-Comprometido. Capacidad de análisis y solución de problemas.

-Buenas habilidades de negociación.

-Capaz de generar empatía tanto con los empleados y clientes.

-Capaz de adaptarse a la cultura de trabajo de una pyme. Sin grandes jerarquías. Compatibilizando la capacidad de trabajar con autonomía con un fuerte espíritu de colaboración y, sobre todo, de trabajo en equipo.

- Interesado en desarrollar su carrera profesional en entornos altamente competitivos y con alto potencial de crecimiento.




Tu comodidad nos importa. Los bluetabers trabajamos en un entorno confortable, agradable y con proyección de carrera. Eso se traduce en:




-Contrato indefinido con un salario competitivo. El salario se relaciona en función de los conocimientos técnicos detectados en el proceso y rol asignado, procurando respetar el sentido de equidad y siendo susceptible de mejora tras las evaluaciones continuas de desempeño.

-Formación continua.

-Plan de carrera individual definido ya sea técnico, funcional o gestión (¡Decide tu camino, pero sigue formándote!).

-Beneficios sociales más allá de tu salario:

- Fondo de Ahorro

-Seguro de gastos médicos menores y de mayores a nivel familiar, seguro de vida.

-Vales de despensa.

- Vacaciones superiores a la ley.

- Bolsa de capacitación

-Bono de bienestar

-Capacitación constante

- Días de descanso adicionales a la ley.




¿Qué esperas para sumarte a Bluetab, an IBM Company?

En /b promovemos la diversidad de género, origen étnico, nacionalidad, la inclusión de personas con discapacidad y/o habilidades diferentes mediante la igualdad de oportunidades en todos los procesos, y buscamos ampliar las oportunidades de desarrollo profesional.




"Bluetab" es una empresa del grupo IBM. Bluetab será la entidad contratante. Al proceder con esta solicitud, usted entiende que Bluetab compartirá su información personal con otras filiales de IBM involucradas en su proceso de reclutamiento, selección y contratación, donde quiera que éstas se encuentren. Encontrará más información sobre cómo IBM protege su información personal, incluidas las medidas en caso de transferencia transfronteriza de datos, aquí: https://www.ibm.com/careers/us-en/privacy-policy/".

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Somos un banco 100% digital especialista en medios de pago con más de 7 años en el mercado. Nuestra misión es buscar evolucionar la gestión del dinero tanto de las personas como de las empresas.




La gente de BPT comparte nuestro ADN único: Brainpower, Drive, Habits, Spirit. Somos parte de un conglomerado multinacional Fintech con un modelo de negocio probado, un equipo multicultural y un producto de clase mundial.




Data Analyst - (Aseguramiento de ingresos)




¿Cómo contribuye esta posición?




Serás parte de un equipo enfocado en el análisis de datos y creación de dashboards. Valoramos la solución de problemas con iniciativas basadas en herramientas de programación como Python o R.

Tu rol contribuye a la creación y mantenimiento de dashboards y automatizaciones para la consulta de información.




Principales responsabilidades

Automatizar y ejecutar procesos de extracción de datos de diversas fuentes.
Automatizar y ejecutar procesos de conciliación y reporteo.
Implementar conciliaciones y monitoreos que controlen el riesgo de fraude.
Elaboración de dashboards




¿Qué buscamos?

Experiencia en la extracción y análisis de datos para el área financiera
Conocimientos solidos en creación de dashboards dinámicos.
Conocimiento en herramientas de datos como Power Query o Power Pivot o Power BI.
Experiencia trabajando con Python/SQL/R
Experiencia trabajando con Webscraping




Beneficios

100% nómina
Prestaciones superiores
Vales de despensa
Cafetería




Sobre el proceso de reclutamiento

Zona de trabajo: Lomas Plaza - Miguel Hidalgo, CDMX. (Cerca de la fuente de Petróleos o Metro Auditorio)
Esquema presencial
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Hi,

Akkodis is seeking a Data Analyst for our contract position with a client located in New York, NY/ Pennington, NG, ideally looking for applicants with a solid background in the Banking & and financial services industry and a strong Quartz AND Tableau.




Position: Data Analyst

Location: New York, NY/ Pennington, NJ

Duration: 12 Months Contract

Pay Range: $60-$65/hour on W2 without benefits,




Job Description:

This position is for the Risk Technology team within Global Markets Tech

The team is preparing now for regulatory compliance projects for the Dodd-Frank Act as it pertains to the credit area of data products

Environment: Oracle platform and Quartz

BI's heavy reliance on Tableau and Alteryx

The manager is looking for a senior analyst with very basic programming skills, highly skilled in using Tableau, and is ideally familiar with Python.

More important is financial market knowledge, either in equities or fixed income, and regulatory knowledge (Dodd-Frank). The team is starting to put together POCs now for 2025 projects and reg compliance deadlines.




Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled

Benefit offerings include medical, dental, vision, term life insurance, short-term disability insurance, additional voluntary benefits, commuter benefits, and a 401K plan. Our program provides employees the flexibility to choose the type of coverage that meets their individual needs. Available paid leave may include Paid Sick Leave, where required by law; any other paid leave required by Federal, State, or local law; and Holiday pay upon meeting eligibility criteria.

To read our Candidate Privacy Information Statement, which explains how we will use your information, please visit https://www.Akkodis.com/en-us/candidate-privacy/

Show more
